easy.notes: Easy category ideas: (1) Things with wheels are vehicles that move on roads. (2) Things that fly go through the air. (3) Pushable playthings are items children often push or pull. (4) Night-glow items are objects associated with light. Near-miss temptation: 'lantern' could be indoors or outdoors; it clearly fits glow-at-night instead of a vehicle or toy group.

medium.notes: Medium category ideas: (1) Suffix group uses -ful endings to hint at a shared tail. Near-miss temptation: 'alarm' could fit 'things you can shake' but is better aligned with sound rather than the suffix concept. (2) Compound word parts clearly link to combined words; avoid other overlapping patterns. (3) Shaking objects is a tangible action; ensure each item is a common object that can be physically shaken. (4) Pairs group relies on items typically worn or used in pairs; some items like 'glasses' are worn on the face and are a natural pair.

groups.name: Words formed by adding a single letter to a base word

hard.notes: Hard category ideas: (1) Color-name overlaps with fruit names requires careful mapping: orange is both a color and a fruit; ensure the solution uses color-color relation where orange clearly belongs to color group, not the fruit type. (2) Word growth by one letter is a clean, but careful, pattern; all items should be reachable by adding one letter to a base word with clear sense. (3) Fictional neighborhoods keep it safe and imaginative; ensure names are distinct. (4) Plant parts are concrete; ensure the connection to other groups isn’t stronger (e.g., leaf could plausibly be a color name in rare cases; avoid ambiguity). Near-miss temptation: 'orange' could tempt as fruit in the color group but the group is color-name overlaps with fruit, so it’s intended to be color-name linkage.
